com.vmware.vcenter

Interface Cluster

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ClusterTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClusterStub

    public interface Cluster
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, ClusterTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Cluster interface provides methods to manage clusters in the vCenter Server.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Cluster.GetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Cluster#get vAPI operation.
      static interface  Cluster.ListInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Cluster#list vAPI operation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.ClusterTypes

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.ClusterTypes

        _VAPI_SERVICE_ID, RESOURCE_TYPE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cluster.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cluster)
      Retrieves information about the cluster corresponding to cluster.
      Cluster.ListInvocation list()
      Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) clusters in vCenter matching the ClusterTypes.FilterSpec.

    • Method Detail

      • list

        Cluster.ListInvocation list()
        Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) clusters in vCenter matching the ClusterTypes.FilterSpec.

        Invocation Result:
        Commonly used information about the clusters matching the ClusterTypes.FilterSpec.

        Returns:
        instance of Cluster.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        UnableToAllocateResource - if more than 1000 clusters match the ClusterTypes.FilterSpec.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

      • get

        Cluster.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cluster)
        Retrieves information about the cluster corresponding to cluster.

        Invocation Result:
        Information about the cluster associated with cluster.

        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        Returns:
        instance of Cluster.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        NotFound - if there is no cluster associated with cluster in the system.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the session id is missing from the request or the corresponding session object cannot be found.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't not have the required privileges.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires System.Read.
